entry.title: The Planning (Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace with amendments, Regulation 20 of the Planning (Hazardous Substances) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1993, the Planning (Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 except for regulation 17 (Fees for Appeals), the Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996, the Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997, the Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998, the Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001, the Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003, the Planning (Fees) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003, and the Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004.

entry.title: The Bishop Justus C of E School (Designation as having a Religious Character) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order designates Bishop Justus CofE School as having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Registration of Social Care Workers (Relevant Registers) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations, which are made under sections 8(6)(b) and 57(3) of the Health and Personal Social Services Act (Northern Ireland) 2001 (“the 2001 Act”) prescribe as relevant registers the registers maintained under provisions of the Care Standards Act 2000 and the Regulation of Care (Scotland) Act 2001 which appear to the Department of Health, Social Services and Public Safety to correspond to provisions of the 2001 Act.

entry.title: The St Benedict’s Catholic VA Primary School (Designation as having a Religious Character) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order designates St Benedict’s Catholic VA Primary School as having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Holy Trinity Catholic Primary School (Designation as having a Religious Character) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order designates Holy Trinity Catholic Primary School as having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Hertsmere Jewish High School (Designation as having a Religious Character) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order designates Hertsmere Jewish High School as having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Health and Personal Social Services (2001 Act) (Commencement No. 7) Order (Northern Ireland) 2005

title.div: The Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Commencement No.3 and Consequential and Transitional Provisions) (Wales) Order 2005 / Gorchymyn Deddf Cynllunio a Phrynu Gorfodol 2004 (Cychwyn Rhif 3 a Darpariaethau Canlyniadol a Throsiannol) (Cymru) 2005

div.p: This Order brings certain further provisions of Part 6 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (“the Act”) into force on 30 April 2005, namely sections 62 and 63 (insofar as they have not already been brought into force), 72 and 73 of the Act.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dod â rhai darpariaethau pellach Rhan 6 o Ddeddf Cynllunio a Phrynu Gorfodol 2004 (“y Ddeddf”), sef adrannau 62 a 63 (i'r graddau nad ydynt eisoes wedi'u dwyn i rym), 72 a 73, i rym ar 30 Ebrill 2005.

title.div: The Demoted Tenancies (Review of Decisions) (Wales) Regulations 2005 / Rheoliadau Tenantiaethau Isradd (Adolygu Penderfyniadau) (Cymru) 2005

div.p: Section 14 of the Anti-social Behaviour Act 2003 amended Part 4 of the Housing Act 1985 (c. 68) to allow a secure tenancy of a local housing authority, a housing action trust or a registered social landlord to be brought to an end and replaced with a less secure demoted tenancy by a demotion order made by a county court. Schedule 1 to the 2003 Act inserted further provisions regarding demoted tenancies as a new Chapter 1A of Part 5 of the Housing Act 1996.

Diwygiodd adran 14 o Ddeddf Ymddygiad Gwrthgymdeithasol 2003 Ran 4 o Ddeddf Tai 1985 (p.68) er mwyn caniatáu i denantiaeth ddiogel awdurdod tai lleol, ymddiriedolaeth gweithredu tai neu landlord cymdeithasol cofrestredig gael eu dirwyn i ben a'u disodli gan denantiaeth isradd lai diogel drwy gyfrwng gorchymyn israddio a wnaethpwyd gan lys sirol. Mewnosododd Atodlen 1 i Ddeddf 2003 ddarpariaethau pellach sy'n ymwneud â thenantiaethau isradd fel Pennod 1A newydd o Ran 5 o Ddeddf Tai 1996.

title.div: The Head Teachers' Qualifications and Registration (Wales) Regulations 2005 / Rheoliadau Cymwysterau a Chofrestru Prifathrawon (Cymru) 2005

div.p: These Regulations, which apply in relation to Wales, make provision requiring first time head teachers of schools maintained by a local education authority and special schools which are not so maintained and who are appointed as a head teacher on or after 1 September 2005 to:

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys mewn perthynas â Chymru, yn gwneud darpariaeth sy'n ei gwneud yn ofynnol bod penaethiaid tro cyntaf ysgolion a gynhelir gan awdurdod addysg lleol ac ysgolion arbennig na chynhelir mohonynt gan awdurdod addysg lleol, ac a benodir yn benaethiaid ar neu ar ôl 1 Medi 2005:

title.div: The Secure Tenancies (Notices) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2005 / Rheoliadau Tenantiaethau Diogel (Hysbysiadau) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2005

div.p: These Regulations amend the Secure Tenancies (Notices) Regulations 1987 as they apply in Wales to prescribe the form of notice which should be served on a secure tenant before a landlord begins proceedings for a demotion order under section 82A of the Housing Act 1985.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Tenantiaethau Diogel (Hysbysiadau) 1987, fel y maent yn gymwys yng Nghymru, i ragnodi'r math ar ffurf ar hysbysiad y dylid ei gyflwyno i denant diogel cyn i landlord gychwyn achos am orchymyn israddio o dan adran 82A o Ddeddf Tai 1985.

title.div: The Anti-social Behaviour Act 2003 (Commencement No.4) (Wales) Order 2005 / Gorchymyn Deddf Ymddygiad Gwrthgymdeithasol 2003 (Cychwyn Rhif 4) (Cymru) 2005

div.p: This Order brings into force on 30 April 2005, in relation to Wales, the remainder of the provisions of Part 2 (Housing) of the Anti-social Behaviour Act 2003.
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym ar 30 Ebrill 2005, o ran Cymru, weddill darpariaethau Rhan 2 (Tai) o Ddeddf Ymddygiad Gwrthgymdeithasol 2003.

title.div: The Food with Added Phytosterols or Phytostanols (Labelling) (Wales) Regulations 2005 / Rheoliadau Bwyd â Ffytosterolau neu Ffytostanolau Ychwanegol (Labelu) (Cymru) 2005

div.p: These Regulations, which apply to Wales only, provide for the enforcement of Commission Regulation (EC) No. 608/2004 (OJ No. L97, 1.4.2004, p.44) concerning the labelling of foods and food ingredients with added phytosterols, phytosterol esters, phytostanols and/or phytostanol esters. That Regulation requires such foods and food ingredients to be labelled with additional information, including the words “with added plant sterols/plant stanols”.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys i Gymru yn unig, yn darparu ar gyfer gorfodi Rheoliad y Comisiwn (EC) Rhif 608/2004 (OJ Rhif L97, 1.4.2004, t.44) ynghylch labelu bwydydd a chynhwysion bwyd â ffytosterolau, esterau ffytosterol, ffytostanolau a/neu esterau ffytostanol ychwanegol. Mae'r Rheoliad hwnnw yn ei gwneud yn ofynnol labelu'r bwydydd a'r cynhwysion bwyd hynny â gwybodaeth ychwanegol, gan gynnwys y geiriau “with added plant sterols/plant stanols”.

entry.title: The Emergency Workers (Scotland) Act 2005 (Commencement) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 9th May 2005 all the provisions of the Emergency Workers (Scotland) Act 2005 except section 9 which relates to short title and commencement. Section 9 of the Act came into force on Royal Assent on 1st February 2005.

entry.title: The Children (Leaving Care) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision about support for children and young people aged 16 and over who are, or have been, looked after by an authority.

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 11) (Scotland) Order 2004 Revocation Order 2005
entry.summary: This version of the The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 11) (Scotland) Order 2004 Revocation Order 2005 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 2) (Scotland) Revocation Order 2005
entry.summary: This version of the The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 2) (Scotland) Revocation Order 2005 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The M40 Motorway Junction 4 (Handy Cross) Connecting Road Scheme 2005
entry.summary: This version of the The M40 Motorway Junction 4 (Handy Cross) Connecting Road Scheme 2005 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Horse Passports (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in Scotland, implement Council Directive 90/426/EEC (O.J. No. L 224, 18/8/1990, p.42), Council Directive 90/427/EEC (O.J. No. L 224, 18/8/1990, p.55) and Commission Decisions 92/353/EEC (O.J. No. L 192, 11/07/1992, p.63), 93/623/EEC (O.J. No. L 298, 3/12/93, p.45) and 2000/68/EC (O.J. No. L 23, 28.1.00, p.72). They revoke and replace the Horse Passports Order 1997 and the Horse Passports (Amendment) Order 1998, with transitional provisions.

entry.title: The Land Management Contracts (Menu Scheme) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Articles 9, 22, 23, 24, 30 and 33 of Council Regulation (EC) No. 1257/1999 on support for rural development from the European Agricultural Guidance and Guarantee Fund (EAGGF), as amended by Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1783/2003, the Act of Accession, Council Regulation (EC) No. 567/2004 and Council Regulation (EC) No. 583/2004. The Regulations extend to Scotland only.
